intro: Loasa bertrandi, commonly known as the velvetleaf loasa, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
